title: 107_s1129
content: PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH. The Executive Schedule pay rates are adjusted based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment is made at the beginning of the first pay period after the comparability payment is payable, with the annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions being adjusted by a corresponding percentage. The Executive Schedule pay rates are adjusted based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. An adjustment under subsection (a) takes precedence over an adjustment under subsection (b). The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions is treated as adjusted, except when otherwise provided by law. Adjustments for Contract appeals board members ensure they receive no less than 97 percent of the rate under paragraph (1). The pay rates for contract appeals board members will be adjusted to no less than 94 percent of the rate under paragraph (1) at the beginning of the first applicable pay period after an adjustment in the rates of basic pay under the General Schedule. Conforming amendments are made to ensure these adjustments are in line with the Executive Schedule. Amendments are made to various sections of title 5, United States Code, excluding any adjustment under section 5318(b) from the Executive Schedule. Additionally, a limitation on certain payments is added for employees receiving basic pay under specific sections. Increases in maximum rates of basic pay allowable for specific positions are detailed, including adjustments for circuit executives and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts. Amendments are made to various sections of title 5, United States Code, changing references from level IV to level III in the Executive Schedule. Section 603 of title 28, United States Code, is also amended to adjust the salary of the Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for pay periods starting on or after the enactment date.
